value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function
value.excerpt: Previously I explained the AddColumns function as a function that adds one or more columns to the existing table, In this article and video, I'll explain another similar and useful function with slightly different behavior: SelectColumns, and you will learn how you can use it in Power BI and DAX. value.title: DAX CrossFilter Function in Power BI   Write the Formula both directional but keep the relationship
value.excerpt: If you are familiar with relationships in Power BI, you know that there are scenarios that you may need to change the direction of the relationship to a both-directional. A both-directional relationship comes at a cost, which is mainly the performance and ambiguity of the model. There is a way to write

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI

This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article

value.title: Power BI DAX RelatedTable Function   Get the subtable related to the current row
value.excerpt: There are multiple functions that can help when you work with tables that are connected through relationships. One of these functions is Relatedtable. This function gives you the subtable from the other table for all the rows related to the current row. For example, all sales transactions (from the Sales
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZrhnliV7Jrw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Modeling Tip   Snapshot Table or DAX Measures

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. value.title: Introducing DEFINE TABLE in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: Naming temporary columns in DAX
value.excerpt: Discuss a naming convention for temporary columns in DAX expressions to avoid ambiguity with the measure reference notation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/377817?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Side effects of the Sort By Column setting in DAX
value.excerpt: The Sort By Column feature in Power BI causes side effects that are important to know when writing a DAX formula. value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Understanding the IN operator in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn the IN operator in DAX, which simplifies logical conditions by checking whether a certain value belongs to a list of values. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More ¬ª

value.title: When to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX
value.excerpt: Ken Puls and I decided we would do a live stream chat to talk about a topic of interest to Power BI people.¬† We put out a survey and 75% of the respondents wanted to hear about “when to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX”.¬† It’s a really interesting topic [...]Read More ¬ª

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you‚Äôll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you‚Äôll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You‚Äôll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you‚Äôll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.
